title: Cultivate Your Own Edamame: A Guide to Growing and Enjoying Soybeans!

tasks.task: Growing soybeans and edamame in a garden or container.
subtasks: Choosing a planting location with proper soil mix, such as compost, peat moss, and perlite.
Planting seeds or transplants in a container (e.g., whiskey barrel) or raised bed.
Watering the planted seeds or transplants thoroughly.
Monitoring and addressing pests such as caterpillars, spider mites, and fungal diseases (e.g., rust) using neem oil.
Ensuring sufficient sunlight (at least 6-8 hours per day).
Applying organic liquid fertilizer and worm tea every two weeks.
Harvesting soybean pods when they mature, typically after two months.
Removing plant material after harvest and disposing of it properly.
Cleaning and salting soybean pods before cooking.
Oil-sautéing edamame in an air fryer or other method.
Cooking edamame at the appropriate temperature and time, tossing occasionally.
Subscribing to a gardening channel for future updates.
Supporting the channel by liking the video and leaving comments.
